meanings.definition: To buy (something) before it is available for purchase.
meanings.sent1: I am prebuying tickets for the concert next month.
meanings.sent2: She always prebuys her favorite snacks before they run out.
meanings.sent3: John thought he was prebuying a time machine online, but it turned out to be a scam.
meanings.sent4: By prebuying the latest smartphone, Sarah felt like she was ahead of the game.
meanings.sent5: The idea of prebuying groceries online seemed strange at first, but now it's so convenient.

meanings.definition: The act of purchasing something in advance.
meanings.sent1: Prebuying is a smart way to ensure you get the best deals.
meanings.sent2: The company offers prebuying options for their new product releases.
meanings.sent3: The prebuying of movie tickets saved us from waiting in long lines.
meanings.sent4: Her prebuying of holiday gifts allowed her to relax during the busy season.
meanings.sent5: The concept of prebuying has become more popular with online shopping.
